title: Shrimp Mobile Data Narrative
projectDescription: Shrimp Mobile Data Narrative is a website about the different types of shrimps discovered and where you can find them. While there are over 2000 species of shrimps in the world, this website only show shrimps that start from 'A' to 'C' from the Integrated Taxonomic Information System and SeaLifeBase database search. The data visualizations shown in the website are Word Cloud, Radial Dendrogram, and Density 2D Hexbin Chart. There is also a React Data Table near the end to show all the shrimps used. Wikipedia was used to explain what shrimps are, and the different environments they appear in.
projectCreation: This project was created with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It uses Bootstrap to make the website mobile-friendly, D3 to create the data visualizations, and React to make it run efficiently.

title: Earth Defense Force CRUD API Mobile Website
projectDescription: Earth Defense Force (EDF) CRUD API Mobile Website is a website where you create your soldier to fight an alien invasion in the video game, Earth Defense Force 6. There is an About Page that give information about the game, the different classes you can play as, and trailers showing the gameplay. You create your soldier by entering a callsign, selecting a class, what they look like, their fighting style, where they'd like to deploy, their favorite enemy to fight, their least favorite enemy to fight, and a motivational photo to upload in the Form Page. After your soldier form is sent, it's entered into a MySQL database and shown in the Filter Form Page where you can filter the data. The filters include their callsign, class, outfit, fighting style, if they played EDF 5 before, how long their callsign is, and how many entries can be shown. For each entry on the database, you can either edit the information or delete it.
projectCreation: This project was created with HTML, CSS, and Javascript. It uses Bootstrap to make the website mobile-friendly, MySQL for the back-end functionality, and React to make it run efficiently.

title: Games, Interactive Media, and Mobile Technology (GIMM) Alumni Website
projectDescription: Games, Interactive Media, and Mobile Technology (GIMM) Alumni Website is a website where GIMM alumni can connect with each other and post job listings for others to view. There is an interactive map to show the alumni across the world, and a senior showcase page for each cohort. A survey page is available for them to fill out and update their information. And an admin account for the GIMM Department to use to verify the forms before sending to the MySQL database.
projectCreation: This project was created with 9 other students, advised by a GIMM professor, and made with React and AWS. We worked with a client, another GIMM professor, to create this website as a hub for alumni of the program to connect, and showcase senior projects from each cohort. My contributions to the project was creating and styling the Senior Showcase Page, based off the Figma design, using HTML and CSS.

title: Blue Note Reserve Mobile App
projectDescription: Blue Note Reserve is a React Native app that allows students in Boise State University's Music Department to reserve practice rooms in the Morrison Center, and earn badges and titles for using them. This app is planned to link with Zoom Rooms, Google Calendar, and Discord. It will be available for students to download on Android and iOS. Zoom Rooms allows students and professors to see if the room is occupied, Google Calendar is used to add your practice room reservation, and Discord to showcase the students' unlocked badges and titles based on their time in the practice rooms. The basic functionality of the app is completed; UI/UX, page styles, some unfinished features and publishing will be given to the next team of students to finish.
projectCreation: This project was created with 7 other students, and made with React Native. We worked with a client, a professor from the music department, to create this app and modernize their room reservation system. My contributions to the project was creating and styling the the Home Page, and started on the Badges and Titles Page. I've created the other pages for the next team to work on. The video only shows my branch of the project, what you see isn't the current state of the app.

title: Personal Web Comic
projectDescription: Personal Web Comic is a web comic series about group of adventurers traveling in an urban fantasy world, searching for a way to defeat a 1000-year-old boogeyman. Some pages will have interactivity to make reading about the characters and setting interesting. The goal of this project was to gain more experience in front-end web development.
projectCreation: This project is currently in development and was created with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It uses Bootstrap to make the website mobile-friendly, D3 to create the data visualizations, and React to make it run efficiently. Images, in this video, were drawn using paper and pencil and photographed with a phone. Updated images will be drawn digitally with a tablet using Krita.
